content: How can I help you today?

I've just been really struggling to sleep lately. It's like my mind won't stop racing with worries about work and bills, and it's putting so much pressure on me. My partner thinks talking to you might help, but honestly, I'm not sure how.

It sounds like trying to manage everything—work, bills, and those racing thoughts—has been really overwhelming for you and making it hard to get the rest you need. It’s understandable to feel unsure about how talking might help when things feel this heavy. What do you think might be contributing to your worries the most right now?

Honestly, I think it's mostly work. Things feel so uncertain right now, and I'm worried about getting fired. If that happens, I don't know how I'll provide for my family. It just feels like this stress is always weighing on me.

It sounds like the uncertainty at work and the responsibility of providing for your family have created this constant weight that’s hard to escape. It makes sense that this stress is affecting your sleep—it’s a lot to carry. What do you think would help lighten that weight or feel a bit different right now?

I honestly don’t know what would help. I mean, I try distracting myself with my phone, but it doesn’t really work. I just end up spiraling further. It feels like I can’t even turn my brain off long enough to figure out a solution.

It seems like you’ve been trying to find ways to cope, like using your phone to distract yourself, but it’s not really giving you the relief you need. Having your thoughts spiral like that can make it hard to see a clear way forward. Even though you’re unsure about solutions right now, it’s clear that finding some relief matters to you. What’s your ideal vision of what things could look like if you weren’t feeling this weight all the time?

I think my ideal would just be feeling more in control—like at work, at home, with my family. I want to feel like I’m providing the way I’m supposed to and actually enjoying time with my kids without all these worries in my head. And being able to sleep—just a solid, stress-free sleep—would be amazing.

It sounds like you’re really craving a sense of control and balance—not just at work but also in your home life and time with your kids. The desire to provide for them and be present seems very important to you, and the thought of good sleep feels like it would give you the energy and clarity to enjoy that balance more deeply. What do you think might help you take even small steps toward feeling more in control or finding that balance right now?

I don’t know… I guess maybe starting with the sleep part could help, but I’m not really sure how to fix that when my brain won’t shut off. It’s hard to focus on any steps when I just feel stuck in this loop, you know?

Feeling stuck in that loop makes it hard to even see where to start, and focusing on sleep feels like it could be a first step toward giving you some relief. Even though you’re unsure how to fix it right now, wanting to take steps shows you care about finding a way forward. What might be one small thing—however small—that feels manageable to try just for the sleep part, even if it’s not perfect?

I guess one small thing might be trying to put my phone down earlier, but honestly, I’d have a hard time doing it. It’s become such a habit when I can’t stop my thoughts. Maybe I could replace it with something else, but I can’t think of what.

That’s a thoughtful idea—putting the phone down earlier, even if it feels like a tough habit to break. Replacing it with something else sounds like a good way to ease the transition. Maybe something calming or engaging, like listening to soft music, reading, or even trying a breathing exercise, could help redirect your thoughts. What sort of activity might feel calming or manageable for you before bed?

I’m not sure. I’ve never really tried stuff like that, but maybe I could listen to music or an audiobook. It might be worth a try, though I’m not sure if it’ll work. I just need something to keep my mind from going into overdrive.

Exploring music or audiobooks sounds like an option that could be soothing and help redirect your mind from racing thoughts—even if it feels uncertain right now. It shows you’re willing to try something new, and that openness is a great step. If you were to give it a try, is there a particular type of music or audiobook that feels comforting or distracting enough to shift your focus before bed?

I think I might try something calming, like soft instrumental music or maybe an audiobook with a relaxing story—something light and not too engaging. I just hope it helps quiet my mind a bit so I can finally get some rest.

Choosing soft instrumental music or a relaxing audiobook sounds like a gentle and manageable way to ease your mind before bed. It’s encouraging to hear that you’re willing to experiment with something new, even if part of you is uncertain. Taking this step could give you a chance to feel a bit more in control of your evenings. How do you feel about setting aside a time tonight or in the coming days to give this a try?

I think I might give it a try tonight, but I won’t lie—it’s hard to feel hopeful about it working. Still, I guess it’s worth a shot. At least it’s something to try instead of staying stuck in the same routine.

Trying something new, even when it feels uncertain, is a meaningful step forward—especially when things feel stuck. It’s clear that you’re willing to put in the effort to create some change, and that’s worth recognizing. If it doesn’t work perfectly at first, that doesn’t take away from the fact that you’re trying. What would success look like for you, even with just this small step tonight?

I think success would just be being able to relax enough to fall asleep a little easier, even if it’s not perfect. Just not feeling so stuck in my head would feel like progress. Hopefully, it’ll help me get at least a little more rest.

That sounds like a meaningful definition of success—finding even a bit of ease so you’re not stuck in your head as much and can get some rest. It’s a realistic goal, and taking this step shows how much you value moving toward relief and balance in your life. If you find even small progress tonight, how might that help you feel about taking other steps toward the change you want?
